availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, merchant and county judge. Married to Mary Jane Turner. Father of Eunice Turner and Mary Turner. Merchant in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850. County Judge in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District Two. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District Two. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 108. Find a Grave, “John N Turner (1819-1889),” Memorial #18481142, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18481142# (accessed May 15, 2018).
